lead_paragraph: Pedicab operators, who say they are already scorned and powerless, face the prospect of losing customers if they are banned from Central Park below 85th Street.

headline.print_headline: Pedicab Operators See Loss of Livelihood in Mayor’s Plan
headline.main: Pedicab Operators See Loss of Livelihood in de Blasio’s Central Park Plan

snippet: Pedicab operators, who say they are already scorned and powerless, face the prospect of losing customers if they are banned from Central Park below 85th Street.
abstract: Pedicab drivers in New York City have raised concerns about Mayor Bill de Blasio's horse carriage deal, which includes ban on pedicabs in Central Park south of 85th Street; many pedicab drivers say ban will make it impossible to continue in their line of work; pedicab industry is one of least sympathetic professions in city, as some drivers are notorious for scamming tourists.
